data.title: Great bugs of the candidate!
data.body:
**TileMap:**
1. Stripes appear (leaves texture). I use 32px textures. (Proof: http://vk.com/doc76044859_437262742)
2. Collision is not working correctly. I used SnapPixel for creating it. When moving the character podprygivaya, and sometimes even may fail. (Proof: http://vk.com/doc76044859_437262741)
3. When moving the camera up slightly TileMap starts to slow down and there is a feeling that starts to fall fps.

**Other:**
1. When you use the check and "murder" of an object he could become immortal with the most negative health. (Proof: http://vk.com/doc76044859_437262740)
Part of the code:

```
func _fixed_process(delta):
    if (health <= 0.0):
        queue_free()
```
- Operating System : Windows 8.1 x64
- Godot: 2.0 RC1 (last)
- Device: Wat? Notebook, Keyboard. 
- GPU Model: AMD Radeon HD 7610M
- Project: http://vk.com/doc76044859_437262786
- For a basis took Platformer2D.

data.title: More keyboard shortcuts please.
data.body:
The keyboard shortcuts that the editor already has are great, but there are some obvious (to me) ones missing that would make production way faster. Primarily:

**Ctrl-N** - new scene
**Ctrl-Tab** and **Ctrl-Shift-Tab** - switch scene, next and previous

And a couple others that would make sense: 

**Ctrl-Shift-N** - new inherited scene
**Ctrl-Shift-A** - add scene file instance as a node

A haven't used the engine a lot yet, but as far as I can tell none of those combinations are used anywhere.

data.title: Give a choice to use OpenGL ES (ANGLE) on Windows
data.body:
Reticketed from #3632.

OpenGL really suxx on my hardware (just 5 years old notebook) and I want to play with Godot. I had some success making it run with [regal](https://github.com/p3/regal) by @nigels-com, but it is still too slow.

Chrome uses OpenGL ES for WebGL and it works ok through [ANGLE](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANGLE_%28software%29) library. Firefox uses it too.

Ideally, it should be possible to select ANGLE renderer with command line.

data.title: Color picker: can't select hue without selecting the shade first
data.body:
When selecting a color, it's quite common to first go to the correct hue and then select the shading.
In godot this is impossible to do at the moment as the vertical hue bar is unresponsive until you select the shading. 

When saturation is 0 (max left in the square shading area) the hue vertical bar becomes unresponsive again. Actually this might be the cause of the problem as when choosing a new color, saturation starts at 0.

data.title: Dynamic backend selection on Windows
data.body:
From https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/c6971308e76a1fdf8d4f72e43f8515a0754b0e14/platform/windows/os_windows.cpp#L941 it looks like the choice of renderer is hardcoded and chosen at engine compile time. So there are 4 renderers:
- OPENGL_ENABLED
- GLES2_ENABLED
- LEGACYGL_ENABLED
- DirectX9

It would be nice to be able to select renderer dynamically at run-time or from command line. For example on Windows OpenGL support is historically poor.

data.title: Godot application does not show up in taskbar on Linux Mint
data.body:
When running Godot on Linux Mint 17.3 (Cinnamon desktop), the application doesn't show up in the taskbar. No entry is added for Godot.
This means that if the window is minimized, it cannot be made visible again via the taskbar, which is a bit annoying.
- Bug seen with Godot 2.0-beta.

Maybe there are some hints missing when creating the X11 window, so Cinnamon's taskbar doesn't consider the window for showing it up there.

I cannot confirm if the bug also exists in other Linux distributions or with other desktop environments (gnome, unity, kde...)

data.title: VARIANT_ENUM_CAST Error
data.body:
I have an enum defined in a C++ class in the header file. When I go to bind it in _bind_methods as per the example in core_object, I get the following:

```
In file included from core/variant.h:46:0,
                 from modules/NewHTTPClient/include/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.h:7,
                 from modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClients.cpp:29:
modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.cpp: In static member function 'static void NewHTTPClient::_bind_methods()':
core/simple_type.h:97:1: error: a template declaration cannot appear at block scope
 template<>\
 ^
core/method_bind.h:89:1: note: in expansion of macro 'SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE'
 SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE( m_enum );\
 ^
modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.cpp:318:2: note: in expansion of macro 'VARIANT_ENUM_CAST'
  VARIANT_ENUM_CAST(NewHTTPClient::HTTPRequestType);
  ^
core/simple_type.h:102:1: error: a template declaration cannot appear at block scope
 template<>\
 ^
core/method_bind.h:89:1: note: in expansion of macro 'SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE'
 SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE( m_enum );\
 ^
modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.cpp:318:2: note: in expansion of macro 'VARIANT_ENUM_CAST'
  VARIANT_ENUM_CAST(NewHTTPClient::HTTPRequestType);
  ^
core/simple_type.h:107:1: error: a template declaration cannot appear at block scope
 template<>\
 ^
core/method_bind.h:89:1: note: in expansion of macro 'SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE'
 SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE( m_enum );\
 ^
modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.cpp:318:2: note: in expansion of macro 'VARIANT_ENUM_CAST'
  VARIANT_ENUM_CAST(NewHTTPClient::HTTPRequestType);
  ^
core/simple_type.h:112:1: error: a template declaration cannot appear at block scope
 template<>\
 ^
core/method_bind.h:89:1: note: in expansion of macro 'SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE'
 SIMPLE_NUMERIC_TYPE( m_enum );\
 ^
modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.cpp:318:2: note: in expansion of macro 'VARIANT_ENUM_CAST'
  VARIANT_ENUM_CAST(NewHTTPClient::HTTPRequestType);
  ^
In file included from core/object_type_db.h:33:0,
                 from core/object.h:684,
                 from core/reference.h:32,
                 from modules/NewHTTPClient/include/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.h:8,
                 from modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.cpp:29:
core/method_bind.h:90:1: error: a template declaration cannot appear at block scope
 template<> \
 ^
modules/NewHTTPClient/NewHTTPClient.cpp:318:2: note: in expansion of macro 'VARIANT_ENUM_CAST'
  VARIANT_ENUM_CAST(NewHTTPClient::HTTPRequestType);
```

Here is _bind_methods:

```
void NewHTTPClient::_bind_methods() 
{
    VARIANT_ENUM_CAST(NewHTTPClient::HTTPRequestType);
    BIND_CONSTANT(GET);
    BIND_CONSTANT(PUT);
    BIND_CONSTANT(HEAD);
    BIND_CONSTANT(POST);
    BIND_CONSTANT(DELETE);

........
omitted for brvity
}
```

If I just use BIND_CONSTANT it works fine. If I use VARIANT_ENUM_CAST without BIND_CONSTANT the compiler spits out errors.

And the enum in NewHTTPClient.h under public:

```
enum HTTPRequestType {GET, PUT, HEAD, POST, DELETE};
```

data.title: Dictionary has has has!
data.body:
I want to check that a json/dictionary has all keys I need so my funktion can work properly.

Right now I have to do this
`if (body_map.has("id") && body_map.has("url") && ...):`
Is there another way?

How about a second has function. hasn( args )
`if ( body_map.hasn("id", "url") ):`
Maybe it is too rare so godot doesn't have to provide it?

Another way would be to use try/catch.
I've seen that someone suggested try/catch to be implemented in GD but I don't like try/catch stuff.

I can write my own function in GD for now...

```
func has(map, args):
    for arg in args:
        if( !map.has(arg) ):
            return false
    return true
```

data.title: OS.get_unique_id only implemented on Android and iOS
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ This issue is actually not specific to HTML5, but `OS.get_unique_ID` is only implemented on Android and iOS; on all other platforms it returns an empty string and an error message.

See https://github.com/godotengine/godot/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=get_unique_ID

---

Seen while testing Minilens in Firefox 64-bit on Linux, Godot 2.0 Beta:

```
close data.pck flags 1
close data.pck flags 1
close data.pck flags 1
ERROR OPENING FILE: icon.png
close data.pck flags 1
[1;31mERROR: get_unique_ID: [0m[1mMethod/Function Failed, returning: ""
[0;31m   At: core/os/os.cpp:459.[0m
close data.pck flags 1
close /userfs/options.txt flags 2
close /userfs/options.txt flags 1
[SUTjoystick]: mouse emulation enabled
close data.pck flags 1
close data.pck flags 1
elapsed 8 tts 4992
elapsed 287 tts 4705
elapsed 89 tts 4616
```

I don't know if the `get_unique_ID` error is related to the previous error about icon.png, so in doubt I give a good chunk of the log.

a fix to this [issue](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3626#issuecomment-181093491)

data.title: fixing typos all over the place
Screen Drag issue
data.body:
It seems that when you grab the input of a screen drag and get the event.speed to apply to linear velocity. It does not work on the device but works on the editor. 
This is the code that i am using

```
func _input(event):
    if(event.type == InputEvent.SCREEN_DRAG):
        dir = event.speed
        set_linear_velocity(dir)
```

data.title: Added numpad emulation (fixes #3612)
data.body:
I think this won't break anything else as the num keys are not used for any other shortcuts.
Added option to turn it on/off in the editor settings->3d editor

data.title: Added constant to retrieve Windows' Documents path
data.body:
Currently, the function `OS.get_system_dir(OS.SYSTEM_DIR_DOCUMENTS)` returns an empty string in Windows.

From the commit message:

According to MSDN's documentation ([(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb762181(v=vs.85).aspx)]),
`CSIDL_PERSONAL` represents the default path to Windows Document's folder:

"Previous to Version 6.0. The file system directory used to physically store a user's common repository of documents. A typical path is `C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents`. This should be distinguished from the virtual My Documents folder in the namespace. To access that virtual folder, use `SHGetFolderLocation`, which returns the `ITEMIDLIST` for the virtual location, or refer to the technique described in Managing the File System."

`SHGetFolderPath()` may fail in some conditions for the Documents folder, though. I believe failures may occur when the user moves the documents folder elsewhere, or uses a symbolic link.

Thanks. Best regards.

data.title: Add math/script expression evaluation in editor (rebase of #453)
data.body:
This pull request rebases #453 to the master branch and fixes a return value in `PropertyEditor::_might_be_in_instance()`.

Steps performed:

```
git remote add  marynate https://github.com/marynate/godot.git
git fetch marynate PR-property-expression
git cherry-pick 5e46258 0d4a7a4
# Fixed conflicts, then applied 5e46258.
git cherry-pick --continue
# Applied 0d4a7a4.
git cherry-pick --continue
```

It follows @marynate implementation; therefore, it currently supports numeric (double) return values.

It is possible to further improve the implementation by supporting other data types using the same strategy (see https://github.com/francogarcia/GD-REPL).

Currently, I managed to run single line expressions and simple code blocks, converting the results to strings. Returning a variant would be more appropriate, I think. Advices are welcome.

Before, however, I would like to know if GDScript has an `eval`/`evaluation` statement, as I could not find one. Actually, looking for it was how I found @marynate's pull request. :)

Thanks in advance. Best regards.

data.title: Enhance XML to reST converter
data.body:
Fixes a number of issues:
- Headings underliners now have the correct length
- Newline+Tabs in descriptions are replaced by two newlines to make a proper paragraph
- [br] are replaced by two newlines, making a proper paragraph
- Properly parse internal hyperlinks in constants description
- Fix broken internal links due to missing newlines
- Show method header even when it has no description, to have something to reference in hyperlinks

Last part of and thus closes #3064.

data.title: Terrain Node and Terrain Engine
data.body:
Hello,

I recently started using Godot and I like it a lot.

I really miss a terrain node for 3D which would make a lot of things much easier.
You can do terrains by importing another mesh or writing scripts but thats really a lot of work.
- unpause

data.title: x11: more verbose checking for joystick capabilities
data.body: ps3 pads (and racing wheels) are now properly detected as joysticks

data.title: Godot Code Editor Highlight All Occurrences
data.body:
Something that I really miss from more featured code editors is being able to highlight all occurrences of a selected portion of the code. On the most basic level this act like a find all feature that immediately highlights everything that matches the highlighted (or selected) portion of the code, this helps you see the flow of a particular variable or function through a script, allowing you to identify where it is introduced and where it is utilized. On a more advanced level this type of feature can be paired with multiple cursors for a powerful and more flexible reversion of replace, quick limited replace, etc.

It is particular useful since you can use different forms of selection for different results, for instance, if you have nothing highlighted, but your caret is over something, then the feature will expand the "selection" to the name that caret is hovering over, this can be done intelligently since the editor understands the syntax of GDScript, and find all matching instances of the selected name. On the other hand if you have something highlighted it acts like a "dumb" find where it will find anything that has the matching text, to better explain the difference:

If you have variables and functions with the following names:
player, player1_score, player2_score, get_player, and find_all_players

and you place your caret on an instance of player, then hit find-all-occurrences (or find next/previous occurrence) it will find all instances of the variable player, it will NOT highlight player1_score, player_score, get_player or find_all_players, however it would highlight player.get_node("something"), as it would understand that the dot operator isn't changing the variable name player into something else.

However, on the other end of the spectrum, if you highlight "player" from any of the instances mentioned above, it will do a dumb search and find the occurrence of player in all of the above, so it will highlight the text "player" in all instances of player1_score, player2_score, get_player and find_all_players.

I'm not sure if adding multiple cursors is really within the scope of this issue post, but potential keybindings for this feature could be split into three different features:

Alt-J : Find Next Occurrence (Go down in the script, if the last occurrence is found then tell the user, if they hit this key again it will wrap to the top of the script)

Shift-Alt-J : Find Previous Occurrence (Go up in the script, if the first occurrence is found then tell the user, if they hit this key again then the search will wrap to the bottom of the script)

Ctrl-Shift-Alt-J : Find All Occurrences (Highlights all occurrences in the script)

Highlighted sections will remain shown until a key is pressed or your click off with the mouse, you should be free to scroll to look at everything. Without a multiple cursor feature, find next and previous occurrence should leave the cursor at the last found occurrence, while find all occurrences will leave the cursor where it was when the feature was activated. Find next and previous should move your view of the script so that you can see the next or previous occurrence, however, find all occurrences should leave the screen location where it is.

data.title: Dragging 2D objects with scale or rotation applied is incorrect
data.body:
I noticed that if you have any Control descendent object whose Scale is not (1, 1), or Rotation != 0, dragging with a mouse is applied in an untransformed way - by simply modifying its Position (x, y).

The expected behavior would drag the object in view space - transforming position back to account for scale and rotation. 

It seems to work correctly for Sprites ( and other Node2Ds ), but incorrectly for Panel ( and other Controls )

data.title: Laptop-friendly shortcuts to switch 3d views
data.body:
While working on a laptop with no numpad, its really hard to switch to left/top/front view since I can't press 7/1/3 on the numpad. I can turn numlock on and off, but it really slows down.

Blender has this option to emulate a num pad, which turns the normal number keys into num pad keys. So can press the numbers in the top row of the keyboard and switch views easily

data.title: Hold modifier key to edit(rotate/scale) in fixed steps
data.body:
A few useful feature to edit objects in blender, is to hold ctrl while editing, in order to change the values in fixed steps.
So I can easily rotate a mesh 45 or 90 using nothing but the ctrl key and my mouse. same thing for scaling (and perhaps moving).

data.title: Allow a state with no selection in VButtonArray
data.body:
At the moment, one of the buttons in VButtonArray has to be selected. This makes sense for keyboard/joypad controlled menus, but it doesn't feel right for touchpad/mouse oriented menus.

It would be nice if, for example, we could set Selected to -1, corresponding to the state in which none of the buttons is selected.

data.title: & in project name shouldn't be escaped
data.body: When the project name contains '&' character, it is replaced by the HTML escape sequence "&" and appears as such in the project list.

data.title: Menu sounds based on themes
data.body:
Many games offer menu sounds, which means a sound plays when the user hovers a button/checkbox/radio buttons or clicks on it.

It would be nice if Godot had a per-theme system to play such menu sounds, without having to create our own node so that all buttons/checkboxes/radio buttons play a sound when hovered/clicked.

data.title: Added get_cellv() method to TileMap
data.body: Fixes #3595
